avalancheActivity.comment: Adjacent to ridgelines and in gullies and bowls avalanche prone wind slabs formed. Many large natural avalanches are possible. The new snow and wind slabs of the last two days can be released easily, even by a single winter sport participant, in all aspects and generally above the tree line. The current avalanche situation calls for extensive experience in the assessment of avalanche danger and careful route selection.
avalancheActivity.highlights: New snow and wind slabs represent the main danger.

snowpackStructure.comment:
Over a wide area over a wide area 50 to 70 cm of snow, and even more in some localities, has fallen above approximately 1500 m. As a consequence of new snow and a moderate to strong wind, large wind slabs formed in the last two days in particular in gullies and bowls and behind abrupt changes in the terrain as well as at intermediate and high altitudes.
The new snow is lying on a crust on sunny slopes. This snow is lying on soft layers on shady slopes and at high altitudes and in high Alpine regions. In its middle, the snowpack is largely stable.

avalancheActivity.comment: Adjacent to ridgelines and in gullies and bowls avalanche prone wind slabs formed. Many large natural avalanches are possible. The new snow and wind slabs of the last two days can be released easily, even by a single winter sport participant, in all aspects and generally above the tree line. As a consequence of the strong westerly wind the avalanche prone locations will become more prevalent as the day progresses. The current avalanche situation calls for extensive experience in the assessment of avalanche danger and careful route selection.
avalancheActivity.highlights: New snow and wind slabs represent the main danger.

snowpackStructure.comment:
Over a wide area over a wide area 50 to 70 cm of snow, and even more in some localities, has fallen above approximately 1500 m. As a consequence of new snow and a moderate to strong wind, large wind slabs formed in the last two days in particular in gullies and bowls and behind abrupt changes in the terrain as well as at intermediate and high altitudes. In addition further wind slabs will form as the day progresses.
The new snow is lying on a crust on sunny slopes. This snow is lying on soft layers on shady slopes and at high altitudes and in high Alpine regions. In its middle, the snowpack is largely stable.

The new snow and wind slabs of the last two days can be released by a single winter sport participant in all aspects and generally above the tree line. snowpackStructure.comment:
Over a wide area 20 to 30 cm of snow, and even more in some localities, has fallen above approximately 2000 m. As a consequence of new snow and a moderate to strong wind, large wind slabs formed in the last two days in particular in gullies and bowls and behind abrupt changes in the terrain as well as at intermediate and high altitudes. In addition further wind slabs will form as the day progresses.
The new snow is lying on a crust on sunny slopes. This snow is lying on soft layers on shady slopes and at high altitudes and in high Alpine regions. In its middle, the snowpack is largely stable.

avalancheActivity.comment: Adjacent to ridgelines and in gullies and bowls sometimes large wind slabs formed. Some medium-sized to large natural avalanches are possible. The new snow and wind slabs of the last two days can be released by a single winter sport participant in all aspects and generally above the tree line. As a consequence of the strong westerly wind the avalanche prone locations will become more prevalent as the day progresses. The current avalanche situation calls for experience in the assessment of avalanche danger.
avalancheActivity.highlights: New snow and wind slabs represent the main danger.

snowpackStructure.comment: Over a wide area 10 to 25 cm of snow, and even more in some localities, has fallen above approximately 2000 m. As a consequence of new snow and a moderate to strong wind, sometimes large wind slabs formed in the last two days in particular in gullies and bowls and behind abrupt changes in the terrain as well as at intermediate and high altitudes. In addition further wind slabs will form as the day progresses. The new snow is lying on a crust in particular on east to south to west facing aspects. In its middle, the snowpack is largely stable.
